citation.article-title: Streptococcus defectivus sp. nov and Streptococcus adjacens sp. nov., nutritionally variant streptococci from human clinical specimens.

p.s: Description of Streptococcus defectivus sp. nov.
Streptococcus defectivus (de. fec' ti. vus. L. adj. defectivus, deficient)
The description below is based on five clinical isolates (3-5).
Gram-positive cocci.
Nonmotile, nonsporulating, catalase negative, and oxidase negative.
Facultatively anaerobic with complex growth requirements.
Grows as satellite colonies adjacent to Staphylococcus epidermidis on horse blood- Trypticase-soy agar and on stored sheep blood agar.
α-Hemolytic on sheep blood agar.
Tiny colonies up to 0.2 mm in diameter are formed on fresh sheep blood agar or on blood agar supplemented with 10 mg of p yridoxal hydrochloride per liter or 100 mg of L-cysteine per liter.
Grows in Todd- Hewitt broth enriched with 10 mg of pyridoxal per liter or 100 mg of cysteine per liter.
Grows in CDMT semisynthetic medium (4) and produces a red chromophore visualized by boiling the bacteria at pH 2 for 5 min.

The morphology depends upon the conditions of growth; the organism is pleomorphic with chains including cocci, coccobacilli, and rod-shaped cells when it is grown in eysteine- or pyridoxalsupplemented broth.
Small ovoid cocci (diameter, 0.40 to 0.55 μm) occur singly, in pairs, or in chains of variable length in CDMT semisynthetic medium.
Some tendency toward rod formation is observed in the stationary phase of growth.
Lactic acid is the predominant acid produced from glucose fermentation.
Resistant to optochin and susceptible to vancomycin.
No production of extracellular polysaccharide from sucrose.
Ungroupable in the Lancefield system, although some strains give a weak reaction with anti-H serum.
Produces pyrrolidonyl-arylamidase and does not produce alkaline phosphatase.
Produces α- and β-galactosidases.
β-Glucuronidase is not produced.
Trehalose is fermented, and inulin is not fermented.
Produces leucine aminopeptidase.
Acid is produced from starch.
β-Glucosidase is not produced.
Hippurate and arginine are not hydrolyzed.
D-Ribose, L-arabinose, D-mannitol, sorbitol, and glycogen are not fermented.
Lactose and D-raffinose are fermented by some strains.
The PBP pattern includes five major bands, at 188, 96. 88, 77, and 62 kilodaltons.
